result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremie D Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $25.00 per month.  2 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremie D Wells

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Jeremie D Wells in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Robin K. Green for Lillian Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.  Req adj for offer.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.
Status conference on October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 27, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jeremie D Wells in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Jeremie D Wells in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
